node.title: Poland Scolds Belarus Diplomat for Nation's 'Deliberate Escalation' of Border Dispute
node.description: Poland said its territory was recently intruded by "uniformed individuals armed with long guns" from neighboring Belarus.

node.title: China Shrugs Off Biden's Criticism for Skipping COP26, Highlights Renewable Energy Feats
node.description: While speaking at the COP26 summit Monday, President Joe Biden said that it was a "big mistake" for China not to make an in-person appearance at the talks.

node.title: Another 'Botched' Execution in Oklahoma Fuels Outrage
node.description: Witness accounts of John Grant's execution differed dramatically from the version offered by the state.

node.title: COVID vaccine could take "life off of pause" for some kids
node.description: Millions of vaccine doses have already been packaged and shipped around the country and are ready for pediatricians and pharmacies to use immediately.

node.title: Russia continues to see daily COVID deaths set new records
node.description: As mistrust of the vaccines and the government fuel a seemingly ceaseless rise in both fatalities and cases, the Kremlin is leaving the big decisions to regional leaders.

node.title: For Knicks, Success (and Failure) Arrives 3 Points at a Time
node.description: A devotion to long-distance shots has changed the Knicks’ approach and their results. But is trading 3s for 3s a winning strategy?

node.title: Derrick Henry May Return, but Not His Shot at These Records
node.description: After falling just shy of Eric Dickerson’s record in 2020, Henry’s pace and an added regular season game gave him another shot. An injured foot will thwart his chase of that total and others.

node.title: Thank You, Claudia Roden!
node.description: Melissa Clark traveled to London to meet the cookbook author and bring back a few recipes.

node.title: As logistical frustrations grow at the U.N. climate conference, organizers blame the pandemic.
node.description: One veteran of the annual gathering described it as the “poorest planed” to date. A young American activist called it a “hellscape.”

node.title: Trump, who had little engagement with Youngkin’s campaign, claims credit for his victory.
node.description: “Without MAGA, he would have lost by 15 points or more,” the former president said in a radio interview.

node.title: Hochul’s New Penn Station Plan Delays Adding More Tracks
node.description: Governor Hochul is putting her own stamp on former Gov. Andrew Cuomo’s proposal, focusing on rebuilding the huge station but putting off its expansion.

node.title: Police Don't Expect $743K Reward for Info on Cleo Smith's Kidnapping to Be Claimed
node.description: Police said they received intelligence Wednesday that helped steer them toward the house in Carnarvon, Australia, where the 4-year-old was found.

node.title: 1 Year After the Election, How Biden's Popularity Stacks Up Against Trump's
node.description: Biden and Trump aren't particularly popular leaders, but in a close election, independents souring on Biden could give Republicans a victory.

node.title: Woman Hears Radio Host Slating New Neighbor Live On-Air, Turns Out It's About Her
node.description: "All she wants to do is talk, talk, talk," said the Chicago radio host on-air about his new neighbor. After her reaction went viral, Sabina called into the show to give her side.

node.title: DOJ Sues to Block Penguin Random House, Simon & Schuster Merger, Calls It Anticompetitive
node.description: Penguin Random House is interested in a merger which would give the world's largest book publisher an even bigger reach by eliminating a prime competitor.

node.title: China, India, Russia Data Masks the World's Real COVID Death Toll
node.description: The global death toll from COVID-19 topped 5 million on November 1, but experts have told Newsweek the true count could be two or three times higher.

node.title: Murder Hornet Corpse Found in Beetle Trap Near Eradicated Washington Nests
node.description: The Washington State Department of Agriculture released a picture of the Asian giant hornet found by British Columbia authorities.

node.title: What You Remember About ‘Jesus Christ Superstar’
node.description: Listening to the album. Singing along at the show. And wearing a loincloth to play the title role. All fresh in our readers’ minds in the 50 years since.

node.title: How to Block Your Phone from Interrupting You
node.description: If the apps, alerts and action on your smartphone are taking up too much of your attention, turn on Focus mode to mute the distractions.

node.title: Parkland Survivor David Hogg Warns SCOTUS Decision Could Lead to More Gun Violence Victims
node.description: "We must refuse to pass this onto another generation," the 21-year-old urged the nine justices on Wednesday.

node.title: If SCOTUS Strikes Down New York's Gun Permit Law, What Other States Could Be Affected
node.description: Experts told Newsweek that 25 percent of Americans could be impacted if the high court were to strike down the law in New York.

node.title: Republicans Are Expected to Block a Second Voting Rights Bill in the Senate
node.description: Democrats hope that a filibuster of a measure named for former Representative John Lewis of Georgia, the civil rights icon, will help build momentum for a change in Senate rules.

node.title: Terry McAuliffe concedes to Glenn Youngkin, a Republican financier, in the Virginia governor’s race.
node.description: The Democrat’s defeat in his bid to return to the governor’s office came a year after Joseph R. Biden Jr. carried Virginia by 10 points.

node.title: The Strange Saga of Huawei
node.description: How the U.S. tries to keep the country safe and competitive as the future of technology becomes less American.

node.title: ISIS Poses a Growing Threat to New Taliban Government in Afghanistan
node.description: The Taliban takeover was supposed to bring an end to war, the new government promised. But a growing insurgency is upending security and raising alarms for the international community.

node.title: Detroit Votes To Decriminalize Drugs Like Magic Mushrooms Amid Psychedelic Renaissance
node.description: The latest move comes as scientists around the world investigate the potential therapeutic applications of such substances.

node.title: China Smashes Record for Number of Military Flights Near Taiwan
node.description: China is on course to double its 2020 total of flights near the island, with its aircraft on pincer-like paths around the island.

node.title: Europe Only Area Where COVID Cases Are Rising, 6 Percent Increase Recorded Last Week
node.description: The World Health Organization reports that cases of COVID-19 across Europe have increased for the fifth consecutive week.

node.title: U.S. Official Confirms Iran Seized Oil Tanker, But Says U.S. Military Just Monitored
node.description: "There were about over 10 Iranian fast boats that swarmed this thing. There was a helicopter scene flying around and, bottom line, our forces responded to monitor the situation," a U.S. defense official said.

node.title: Former NYPD captain Eric Adams elected mayor of New York City
node.description: In his election night speech, Adams said his victory is for "the underserved, the marginalized, the abandoned" who have felt "betrayed" by New York City.

node.title: Julianne Boyd to Retire After 27 Years at Barrington Stage
node.description: Under her leadership, the nonprofit produced “The 25th Annual Putnam County Spelling Bee” and other shows that made it to Broadway.

node.title: What to Read: 4 New Coffee Table Books
node.description: From a compendium of contemporary Black artists to American family portraits to photographs of nature at its most serene, the images herein reveal decades’ worth of research and reflection.

node.title: Newly Published, From Elie Wiesel to ‘The Loneliest Americans’
node.description: A selection of books published this week.

node.title: An Almanac of Covid Dreams
node.description: At the height of the pandemic in 2020, thousands of people shared their Covid dreams on Twitter, many of them under the hashtag #coronadreams. Here is a small selection.

node.title: Brazil presents itself as part of the solution, but critics see a climate scofflaw.
node.description: By Manuela Andreoni

node.title: Galaxies Are Being Killed by 'Spectacular and Violent' External Forces
node.description: New research has revealed that galaxies are being sent to cosmic graveyards because a crucial ingredient needed for star formation is being snatched from them.

node.title: Thieves Target Shipping Containers Amid Logjam at America's Ports
node.description: Cargo has been targeted in LA as the county struggles to clear backlogs of containers in the shipping crisis.

node.title: Israeli court halts auction of Auschwitz tattoo kit
node.description: An Israeli court suspends the auction of a partial tattoo kit billed as having been used on inmates at the Auschwitz death camp, following an outcry from Holocaust survivors.

node.title: ‘Everything About You Must Say Power’
node.description: New York City’s new mayor, Eric Adams, pays a lot of attention to what he wears. You should, too.

node.title: Central banks around the world are dialing back their pandemic-era support.
node.description: The Federal Reserve, the Bank of England and the Reserve Bank of Australia are among several central banks pulling back support as inflation jumps.

node.title: Protesters march over ‘greenwashing.’
node.description: As the focus of the Glasgow summit turns to funding, protesters call for greater accountability for companies’ climate promises.

node.title: Palestinian families reject deal to delay east Jerusalem evictions
node.description: The families said the Israeli court's proposal to end a decades-long legal battle forced them to "choose between our own dispossession or submitting to an oppressive agreement."

node.title: Car belonging to teen missing for 39 years found in river
node.description: "This is a very significant development in this case and we are still processing the car for any additional evidence," the district attorney said.

node.title: Jay-Z joins Instagram
node.description: The rapper and business mogul gained more than 1 million followers in just hours.

node.title: Critics say Australia’s climate pledges fall short, again.
node.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison did not announce any firm plans to move away from the country’s deep investment in fossil fuel production.

node.title: Catch up on Election Day results from around the United States.
node.description: The governor’s races in Virginia and New Jersey and the New York City mayoral election were among the highlights.

node.title: New Funding Offshoot Expands Grants to Southeastern Arts Groups
node.description: In the Southern Cultural Treasures program, the Ford Foundation and an Atlanta nonprofit will funnel aid to that region.

node.title: House Hunting in Mexico: A Modern Hillside Masterpiece in Acapulco
node.description: Once a destination for international jet-setters, Acapulco has been plagued by violence in recent years, though it remains popular with Mexican tourists.

node.title: True Spread of AY.4.2 Variant, Which Could Spread Faster, Unclear Due to Sequencing Issues
node.description: The Delta sub-variant of coronavirus continues to spread, but U.S. totals have varied widely in recent days, data shows.

node.title: Thai police chief 'Joe Ferrari' charged with murder over suspect's death
node.description: A Thai police colonel known for his extravagant collection of luxury cars and famous girlfriend is charged with killing a suspected drug dealer while trying to extort him for money.

node.title: Your Guide to the 2021 New York City Marathon
node.description: Everything you need to know about the 50th running of the five borough race.

node.title: How Atlanta Retooled Its Team on the Fly
node.description: The Braves needed to turn their season around this summer. To say it worked is an understatement.

node.title: Americans told to prepare to flee amid possible war crimes in Ethiopia
node.description: U.N. says atrocities in "reckless" war between Ethiopian government and Tigrayan rebels "may amount to war crimes and crimes against humanity," as the U.S. urges citizens to pack their bags.

node.title: Woman Catches 329lb Shark, Wins Florida Competition in Case of Beginner's Luck
node.description: The shark is the largest caught at the annual contest for 20 years and was from a species that is considered one of the "big three" in terms of attacks on humans.

node.title: Governments must create millions of new green jobs, Ban Ki-moon says.
node.description: His comments come amid rising concern that transitioning to a greener economy could provoke a backlash if the cost falls to low- and middle-income people.

node.title: Hastings Law to Change Name Linked to Native Massacres

node.title: Killed in a 1961 Crash, ‘Unknown Boy’ Is Finally Identified
node.description: The mystery of a teenage hitchhiker, now identified as Daniel Paul Armantrout, was solved 60 years later because of advances in DNA technology and genealogy.

node.title: Prince Andrew Prepares for Epstein Hearing After Targeting Accuser's Reputation
node.description: Prince Andrew's lawyer will take part in a court hearing days after saying accuser Virginia Giuffre was a Jeffrey Epstein recruiter motivated by profit.

node.title: Woman Hopes Father She's Never Met Will Save Her Life by Donating Bone Marrow
node.description: "I'm on a quest to find my father, it could potentially save my life," said Sarah Langdale, who suffers from a rare blood condition called aplastic anaemia.

node.title: Teacher Who Quit After January 6 Photo Emerged Gets Elected to School's Board
node.description: Matthew Lynch left his job at Braintree High School after 10 years over images showing him at the riot in Washington, D.C.

node.title: Iran claims it thwarted a U.S. attempt to "steal" tanker full of oil
node.description: The alleged incident off Iran's southern coast, which the U.S. has not confirmed, would be the latest sign of mounting tension, and fading hopes for a new deal to limit Iran's nuclear program.

node.title: Atrocities on All Sides in Ethiopia’s War, U.N. Says as Rebels Advance
node.description: The United Nations report, released during a state of emergency as rebel forces near the capital, was written under significant constraints imposed by the government.

node.title: Yellowstone Volcano's Norris Geyser Basin Has Risen
node.description: GPS monitoring shows uplift of 1.5cm over the last few months, although the underlying cause of the move is unclear.

node.title: What's behind the push for a fourth stimulus check
node.description: IRS has distributed almost 170 million payments. But hardship remains widespread as the Delta variant spreads.

node.title: Dog chases mountain lion in home's backyard to protect his family
node.description: Rocky, a pit bull, is seen on surveillance video chasing the large cat up a hill behind the house into the woods. He suffered 8 puncture wounds needing 30 stitches, but his family says he's a hero.

node.title: COVID-19 vaccine for kids: What parents need to know
node.description: Children as young as 5 years old could start vaccinations as early as November 3.

node.title: CDC recommends Pfizer's COVID vaccine for kids as young as 5
node.description: The decision follows a unanimous vote by the agency's outside vaccine experts to recommend Pfizer's COVID-19 vaccine for younger children.

node.title: Michelle Wu becomes Boston's first woman, Asian American mayor
node.description: Wu, the daughter of Taiwanese immigrants, will be the first non-white and non-male mayor in Boston's history when she takes office on November 16.

node.title: A Republican narrowly flipped a State House seat in San Antonio.
node.description: John Lujan, a 59-year-old retired firefighter, won the seat, a blow for Democrats in the Texas city.

node.title: New York Times Adds 455,000 Subscribers in Third Quarter
node.description: After moving behind a paywall, Wirecutter added to the company’s revenue stream.

node.title: Trump's SCOTUS Picks Barrett, Kavanaugh, Gorsuch See Their First Gun Case: What to Expect
node.description: The current court is poised to be even more conservative than it was when it last established a nationwide right to keep a gun at home for self-defense.

node.title: National Sandwich Day 2021: The Best Deals and Lunch Offers
node.description: National Sandwich Day takes place on November 3, meaning some big brands from Subway to White Castle are celebrating with deals and events.

node.title: 2021 Election Results: CBS News projects Glenn Youngkin wins Virginia governor's race
node.description: In New Jersey, incumbent Governor Phil Murphy hasn't locked down what was expected to be a relatively easy win.

node.title: New Ronald Greene autopsy refutes police's claim in fatal arrest
node.description: Louisiana troopers were seen on body camera video​ beating, stunning and dragging the Black motorist.

node.title: Yellen says the U.S. will help raise $500 million for green bonds.

node.title: ‘The Harder They Fall’ Review: A New Look for the Old West
node.description: Jeymes Samuel’s film is a bloody horse opera with a charismatic cast.

node.title: Environment groups criticise govt's decision to avoid methane cuts
node.description: Environmental groups say it is pointless and cynical for the government to sign up to a global pact to drastically slash methane emissions when it has no plans to match the goal itself.

node.title: Is inflation "transitory"? Some experts say brace for more
node.description: The Federal Reserve describes higher inflation as fleeting, but economists expect it to stick around into 2022.

node.title: Witness says Kyle Rittenhouse called him seconds after shooting
node.description: A friend of Kyle Rittenhouse testified that the Illinois teen told him he had to fire gun because "people were trying to hurt him."

node.title: Here's How To Do Joint Posts on Instagram
node.description: Instagram has introduced a new "Collab" tool that allows you to publish feed posts and reels with co-authors. Here is how to create one of these joint posts.

node.title: Southwest pilot allegedly assaulted flight attendant in mask dispute
node.description: The incident comes amid a surge in unruly airline passengers​ this year, who sometimes become violent​.

node.title: Virginia Goes Red
node.description: Republicans had a good election night.

node.title: 'Read this': Alec Baldwin hits back at claims of 'chaos' on Rust set
node.description: Actor Alec Baldwin shares a message on social media disputing reports of chaos and a lax attitude toward safety on the set of Western movie Rust, where he accidentally shot and killed a cinematographer.

node.title: Supreme Court to hear major gun rights case
node.description: The case involves a New York law that restricts who can carry a handgun in public for self-defense.

node.title: Spain is facing the loss of a major source of natural gas.
node.description: Algeria, locked in a dispute with Morocco, has shut down a significant gas pipeline.

node.title: Hockey Backtracks on Plan to Eject Chinese Team From Olympics
node.description: Weeks after a top hockey official suggested quality concerns could see China’s men kicked out of the Beijing Games, the team’s participation was confirmed.

node.title: Gary Bettman Defends N.H.L.’s Response to Sexual Abuse Accusation
node.description: The commissioner spoke publicly to address criticism of the way the league handled a player’s sexual assault accusation against a former Chicago coach.

node.title: A new $10.5 billion fund aims to spur green energy projects in poor countries.
node.description: Its backers say it will jump-start investments in clean energy that would not otherwise draw private investors.

node.title: Global finance industry says it has $130 trillion to invest in efforts to tackle climate change.
node.description: The pledge would transform the international financial system, but critics say it falls short on fossil fuels.

node.title: "Suitcase murder" woman returning to U.S. from Indonesia
node.description: Heather Mack and her lawyers are concerned she'll be taken into federal custody. She was convicted of helping her boyfriend kill her mother on vacation in Indonesia and hiding the body in a suitcase.

node.title: Iran expert Norman Roule on escalating tensions with Tehran

node.title: New Jersey’s governor’s race is too close to call.

node.title: Heat, Hunger and Fear: How Jim Jones Kept his Followers in Check
node.description: Jim Jones went to lengths to hide the fact that his Guyana experiment was an abject failure.

node.title: Mooney scores breathtaking century in Scorchers' WBBL win over Renegades
node.description: Opener Beth Mooney smashes an unbeaten 101 off just 63 deliveries, as the Perth Scorchers record a comfortable 40-run win over the Melbourne Renegades.

node.title: European Lawmakers Visit Taiwan, Brushing Off China's Warnings
node.description: The trip was not officially confirmed until the multinational group of EU lawmakers landed in Taipei on Wednesday morning.

node.title: Weird Exoplanets Made of Rocks Unlike Anything Found in the Solar System
node.description: By studying 23 white dwarfs within 650 light-years of our sun, researchers have found materials absent from the solar system.

node.title: Prince Harry's Carbon Pledge Pressures Royals Day After Queen Omits Him From Speech
node.description: It may be hard for the royal family to reach net zero by 2030 as castles and palaces are hard to make energy efficient due to their age and listed status.

node.title: CNN's Van Jones Dubs Glenn Youngkin the 'Delta Variant of Trumpism'
node.description: "In other words, Youngkin, same disease, but spreads a lot faster and can get a lot more places," the political commentator said as the polls closed on Election Day.

node.title: Climate Change Threatens Wine, and a Way of Life, in Jura
node.description: Extreme weather has ruined grape crops throughout this small French region known for natural wine. “If it continues like this, how will we continue to make Jura wine? I really don’t know,” said one winegrower.

node.title: The Strange Effects of Putting an Ordinary Woman Into Glamorous Images
node.description: Celeste Barber’s Instagram elegantly prompts us to consider why we put so much stock in unrealistic imagery.
